item.title: Galera
item.description: Recover Disaster Restart a stopped Galera Cluster On one of the node change safe_to_bootstrap to 1 in /var/lib/mysql/grastate.dat # GALERA saved state version: 2.1 uuid: 34546540-er30-1223-rsa0-23343fesf25c seqno: -1 cert_index: safe_to_bootstrap: 1 ðŸ‘‰ On a running node `seqno: -1` is a normal behaviour, in case of crash find the highest to be sure to bootstrap from the safety node Start a new cluster $ galera_new_cluster The others nodes $ systemctl restart mariadb Monitoring Galera Cluster Show all wsrep MariaDB [(none)]> SHOW GLOBAL STATUS LIKE 'wsrep_%'; Check cluster integrity MariaDB [(none)]> SHOW GLOBAL STATUS LIKE 'wsrep_cluster_state_uuid'; Show cluster size MariaDB [(none)]> SHOW GLOBAL STATUS LIKE 'wsrep_cluster_size'; Show cluster status MariaDB [(none)]> SHOW GLOBAL STATUS LIKE 'wsrep_cluster_status'; Show node status Show if the node can accept queries :
